revised_title: Observations on the New Mediterranean Volcano and its Effects
tldr: The author, John Davy, reports on the changes and disappearance of a new volcano in the Mediterranean. He discusses the various observations made, including the crater's composition, the effects of the eruption on the surrounding area, and the connection between the volcano and other phenomena such as earthquakes and atmospheric changes. He also addresses the misconception that the crater was formed from a bed of sea rock and the speculation about the relationship between the volcano and the cholera epidemic.
